org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.cloud

Class VirtualAppliance

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.DomainWrapper<com.abiquo.server.core.cloud.VirtualApplianceDto>
      • org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.cloud.VirtualAppliance

  • public class VirtualAppliance
extends DomainWrapper<com.abiquo.server.core.cloud.VirtualApplianceDto>
    Represents a virtual appliance.

    A virtual appliance is a logic container for virtual machines that together make an appliance.

    Author:
    Ignasi Barrera, Francesc Montserrat
    See Also:
    http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/Virtual+Appliance+Resource

      • deploy

        public AsyncTask[] deploy()
        Deploys the virtual appliance.

        This method will start the deployment of all the virtual machines in the virtual appliance, and will return an AsyncTask reference for each deployment operation. The deployment will finish when all individual tasks finish.

        Returns:
        The list of tasks corresponding to the deploy process of each virtual machine in the appliance.

      • deploy

        public AsyncTask[] deploy(boolean forceEnterpriseSoftLimits)
        Deploys the virtual appliance.

        This method will start the deployment of all the virtual machines in the virtual appliance, and will return an AsyncTask reference for each deploy operation. The deployment will finish when all individual tasks finish.

        Parameters:
        forceEnterpriseSoftLimits - Boolean indicating if the deployment must be executed even if the enterprise soft limits are reached.
        Returns:
        The list of tasks corresponding to the deploy process of each virtual machine in the appliance.

      • undeploy

        public AsyncTask[] undeploy()
        Undeploys the virtual appliance.

        This method will start the undeploy of all the virtual machines in the virtual appliance, and will return an AsyncTask reference for each undeploy operation. The undeploy will finish when all individual tasks finish.

        Returns:
        The list of tasks corresponding to the undeploy process of each virtual machine in the appliance.

      • undeploy

        public AsyncTask[] undeploy(boolean forceUndeploy)
        Undeploys the virtual appliance.

        This method will start the undeploy of all the virtual machines in the virtual appliance, and will return an AsyncTask reference for each undeploy operation. The undeploy will finish when all individual tasks finish.

        Parameters:
        forceUndeploy - Boolean flag to force the undeploy even if the virtual appliance contains imported virtual machines.
        Returns:
        The list of tasks corresponding to the undeploy process of each virtual machine in the appliance.
